projectPurpose: To provide a fully functional and high-performance web browser experience capable of rendering modern web pages within a terminal environment without requiring a graphical display.
mainFeatures: Supports modern Web APIs (WebGL, WebGPU, audio/video, animations)
Fast startup and high performance (60 FPS, 0% CPU idle)
Works without a window server (supports SSH)

alternatives.name: Lynx
mainFeatures: Supports various protocols (HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, Gopher, etc.)
Useful for low bandwidth and accessibility

alternatives.name: Browsh
mainFeatures: Renders modern web pages using headless Firefox

alternatives.name: cURL
alternatives.license: Open Source - MIT/X derivate license (curl license)
mainFeatures: Supports numerous protocols (HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, etc.)

alternatives.name: Headless Chromium
mainFeatures: Runs Chromium in a non-graphical environment

marketPositioning: Carbonyl is positioned as a modern, high-fidelity terminal web browser that leverages the full power of the Chromium rendering engine. It differentiates itself from traditional text-based browsers by offering comprehensive support for modern web standards and APIs, providing a browsing experience closer to a graphical browser but within the terminal. Compared to other modern terminal browsers that use full engines, Carbonyl emphasizes performance and efficiency through its direct rendering approach. Its market niche is users who require full web functionality in a terminal environment, particularly where graphical interfaces are unavailable or impractical.
